t: Let Your Glory Be over All the Earth
To the choirmaster: according to Do Not Destroy. A Miktam of David, when he fled from Saul, in the cave.
Be*pn merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for*ld in you my soul takes refuge; in*ln the shadow of your wings I will take refuge, till*ld the storms of destruction pass by.
I*ln cry out to God Most High, to*ld God who fulfills his purpose for me.
He*ln will send from heaven and save me; he*ld will put to shame him who tramples on me. Selah*ig God*ln will send out his steadfast love and his faithfulness!
My*pn soul is in the midst of lions; I*ld lie down amid fiery beastsâ€” the*ln children of man, whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose*ld tongues are sharp swords.
Be*pn exalted, O God, above the heavens! Let*ld your glory be over all the earth!
They*pn set a net for my steps; my*ld soul was bowed down. They*ln dug a pit in my way, but*ld they have fallen into it themselves. Selah*ig
My*ln heart is steadfast, O God, my*ld heart is steadfast! I*ln will sing and make melody!
Awake,*ld my glory! Awake,*ln O harp and lyre! I*ld will awake the dawn!
I*ln will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the peoples; I*ld will sing praises to you among the nations.
For*ln your steadfast love is great to the heavens, your*ld faithfulness to the clouds.
Be*pn exalted, O God, above the heavens! Let*ld your glory be over all the earth!
